prompt:
Tell me about the most famous hurricane in history. How did it affect people and places?
In 1900, Hurricane San Ciriaco affected Central America. It was the deadliest natural disaster of the twentieth century, killing around 20,000-30,000 people. The hurricane hit Nicaragua first and then Honduras with heavy rainfall causing major flooding, mudslides, and landslides. These events destroyed homes and buildings in both countries along with the loss of many lives.
